contentrichtext.text: The '''German Forum Party''' ({{lang-de|Deutsche Forumpartei}}) was an opposition [[political party]] in [[East Germany]]. It was formed from the [[New Forum]] (''Neues Forum'') citizens' movement. It was founded in [[Chemnitz|Karl-Marx-Stadt]] (now Chemnitz) on 27 January 1990. Its first chairman was JÃ¼rgen Schmieder. It described itself as being at the political centre. It was invited to join the Christian Democrat dominated [[Alliance for Germany]] coalition for the 1990 [[Volkskammer]] election but instead it joined the [[Association of Free Democrats]] in 12 February 1990. ==See also== *[[Liberalism]] *[[Contributions to liberal theory]] *[[Liberalism worldwide]] *[[List of liberal parties]] *[[Liberal democracy]] *[[Liberalism in Germany]] ==External links== *[http://www.chronikderwende.de/english/term.jsp?key=E_DFP German Forum Party from ''Chronik der Wende''] {{GDR political parties}} [[Category:Defunct liberal political parties|Germany 1990]] [[Category:Political parties in East Germany]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1990]] [[Category:1990 establishments in East Germany]] {{Euro-liberalparty-stub}} {{Germany-party-stub}}
